goal.core.runtime.service.agent

Class RunState<D extends Debugger>

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.core.runtime.service.agent.RunState<D>
  • Type Parameters:
    D - The debugger type

    public class RunState<D extends Debugger>
extends java.lang.Object
    The run state of an Agent.

    Note that this has nothing to do with the SteppingDebugger's SteppingDebugger.RunMode .A

    Author:
    W.Pasman

      DOC
      void startCycle(boolean isActionPerformed, java.util.Set<eis.iilang.Percept> initial)
      Perform preparations for starting a new cycle: send outgoing mails Increment the round counter (if not asleep). Display round separator via debugger (if not asleep). Collect and process percepts. Collect and process messages. Execute the init and event module, if present. This function may go to sleep until there are new percepts or messages.

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws KRInitFailedException
        Resetting is same as soft kill and replacing mental state with new initial mental state. TODO: merge kill and reset functionality, basically we have: - reset which now replaces mental state with initial one (TODO: possibly in the middle of an agent run(!); things are not so simple here, if we kill the agent's thread, environment entities, if any, are also freed up again, and a new agent is MAY be (re-)launched immediately instead of using this agent... (but only if the launch rules would still allow for it, which is not what we want). - soft kill that only kills agent thread - hard kill which kills agent thread, cleans up mental state, and kills connection with messaging service and TODO: environment.
        Throws:
        GOALLaunchFailureException - DOC
        KRInitFailedException

      • processPercepts

        public void processPercepts(java.util.Set<eis.iilang.Percept> newPercepts,
                   java.util.Set<eis.iilang.Percept> previousPercepts)
        Processes EIS percepts received from the agent's environment. Converts EIS Percepts to DatabaseFormulas and inserts new and removes old percepts from the percept base.
        Parameters:
        newPercepts - The percepts to be processed.
        previousPercepts - The percepts processed last round.

      • startCycle

        public void startCycle(boolean isActionPerformed)
        DOC
        Parameters:
        isActionPerformed -

      • startCycle

        public void startCycle(boolean isActionPerformed,
              java.util.Set<eis.iilang.Percept> initial)
        Perform preparations for starting a new cycle:
        • send outgoing mails
        • Increment the round counter (if not asleep).
        • Display round separator via debugger (if not asleep).
        • Collect and process percepts.
        • Collect and process messages.
        • Execute the init and event module, if present.
        This function may go to sleep until there are new percepts or messages.
        Parameters:
        isActionPerformed - is true if there has been performed an action between this call and the previous call to startCycle(boolean). We only consider going to sleep if this is false.
        initial - the initial set of percepts to use

      • getMainModule

        public Module getMainModule()
        Returns the main module from the program. If the program does not have a main module, a "dummy" instance of a main module is returned; see #RunState(EnvironmentPort, MessageBox, GOALProgram).
        Returns:
        The main module of the program, or a "dummy" instance if the program does not have a main module.

      • getActiveModule

        public Module getActiveModule()
        Returns the module that was entered most recently. FileLearner is only user of this method, see RuleSet.run(RunState, goal.core.kr.language.Substitution).
        Returns:
        The (non-anonymous) module that was entered last.

      • enteredModule

        public void enteredModule(Module module)
        Pushes (non-anonymous) module that was just entered onto stack and changes top level context if one of init, event, or main module has been entered.
        Parameters:
        module - A (non-anonymous) module.

      • exitModule

        public boolean exitModule(Module module)
        Removes the last entered (non-anonymous) module from the stack of active modules. Should be called when exiting *any* module. The topLevelRunContext is updated here as well.
        Parameters:
        module - The module that is exited.
        Returns:
        true if another module is re-entered from a non- anonymous module.

      • isMainModuleRunning

        public boolean isMainModuleRunning()
        Check if main module is context in which we run now.
        Returns:
        true if main module is context in which we run now.
